messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ramagon!  (Lego compatible building sets)
messages.msgSnippet: On the radio this morning: DJ:  Well, are you getting ready for school? Listener:  Yes, we ve gone school shopping all last week. DJ:  What did you
messages.messageBody:
On the radio this morning:

DJ: "Well, are you getting ready for school?"

Listener: "Yes, we've gone school shopping all last week."

DJ: "What did you spend?"

Listener: "Well, we spent $100 for school supplies."

DJ: "How many children do you have?"

Listener: "One."

DJ: "Wow, we only spent that for three children."

Listener: "Well $40 of that was what she has to take to school."

DJ: "What about clothes?"

Listener: "Well, we've spent $600 so far."

DJ: "Well, what do you think about uniforms . . . ."

And on and on and I sat there with a big grin thinking, "teehee, we don't
have to play keep up with the Jones! and our kids are sooooo much happier!"

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ramagon!  (Lego compatible building sets)
messages.msgSnippet: Oh dear Sandra...I definitely don t need any encouragement to spend money on cool things....  Ha, ha......! But thanks for giving me another way to tell my dh
messages.messageBody:
Oh dear Sandra...I definitely don't need any encouragement to spend money on
cool things.... Ha, ha......!
But thanks for giving me another way to tell my dh why I bought something else!
;)
Lets see a set of Ramagon, and a set of Lego Mindstorm.....well, who needs food
for the month. I need to lose lots of weight anyway! ;)
Ann

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ramagon!  (Lego compatible building sets)
messages.messageBody:
<< those look very cool. I can see my kids drooling now.
Too bad it's not Christmas!! >>

It's August! Back-To-School time!!
All that money you didn't have to spend on crayons, scissors, glue, a pink
eraser, a ruler, spiral notebooks, three-ring binder (and two replacements
before the year's over), book covers, protractor and compass, lunch box, new
jacket, locker stuff (lock, mirror, cool magnetic pen holder)--that can go
toward Ramagon!

And your kids will like it so much you'll be ready to buy them some more at
Christmas.

That site made me think of ordering Marty some more. He does marvelous
things with it, and the sets we have are many years old.

Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd

messages.subject: Ramagon!  (Lego compatible building sets)
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.ramagon.com/store/comcenter.html http://www.ramagon.com is the main page but you ll have to click around to see any examples. But you can order!
messages.messageBody:
http://www.ramagon.com/store/comcenter.html

http://www.ramagon.com
is the main page but you'll have to click around to see any examples.
But you can order!

That page has a picture of a kind of thing my kids like to build.

The site doesn't have the greatest illustrations, but if your kids like Lego,
they would not be disappointed in Ramagon at all! The prices are a bit lower
than Discovery Toys' price (the sets aren't the same, and maybe a bit
smaller, though, and you probably don't get any big guarantee, but the're not
easily breakable).

Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd
